title: Drawing, Mother and Two Children in a Boudoir, possibly 1782
title_raw: Mother and Two Children in a Boudoir
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor on white paper, lined
markings: Stamp: "M" over "B" [?], in black, lower left corner and lining paper, similar to Michele Bisi, Lugt 1659
signed: Signed and dated in pen and brown ink, lower edge, center:  J.B. hüet 178 [?]
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Howard J. Sachs and Mr. Peter G. Sachs in memory of Miss Edith L. Sachs
description: Woman holding a fruit sits on a low chair.   One son kneeling on the floor to the left reaches for the fruit, while a younger baby in a cradle [?] to the right also gestures for the fruit.  A painted screen and a toy horse fill the left side of the room and a chair in the right foreground and drapery behind the cradle complete the boudoir interior.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Mother and Two Children in a Boudoir, possibly 1782. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor on white paper, lined. 
Gift of Mrs. Howard J. Sachs and Mr. Peter G. Sachs in memory of Miss Edith L. Sachs. 1978-168-36.
